etymology.description: a field of grain, hence of uniform height.
etymology.interpretation: Rows of grain of the same height evoke uniformity and order, which motivates meanings like “even,” “neat,” and “in unison.” The same graph is also used as the proper name of the ancient State of Qi.
etymology.simplification: Adopted as the PRC simplified form of 齊 by selecting a long-standing informal variant with fewer strokes; it is not derived from 斉 and is unrelated to 乔, 文, or 儿.

examples.chinese: 他把头发理得很齐(他把頭髮理得很齊)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ tóufa lǐ de hěn qí.
examples.english: He trimmed his hair very evenly.

examples.chinese: 我们齐声歌唱(我們齊聲歌唱)。
战国时期的齐国位于今天的山东(戰國時期的齊國位於今天的山東)。
examples.pinyin: Zhànguó shíqī de Qíguó wèi yú jīntiān de Shāndōng.
examples.english: During the Warring States period, the State of Qi was located in today’s Shandong.
